section.title: Introduction
section.t: GeoJSON is a geospatial data interchange format based on JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) . It defines several types of JSON objects and the manner in which they are combined to represent data about geographic features, their properties, and their spatial extents.

abstract.t: GeoJSON is a geospatial data interchange format based on JavaScript Object Notation (JSON). It defines several types of JSON objects and the manner in which they are combined to represent data about geographic features, their properties, and their spatial extents. This document recommends a single coordinate reference system based on WGS 84. Other coordinate reference systems are not recommended.

front.title: The JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) Data Interchange Format

abstract.t: JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) is a lightweight, text-based, language-independent data interchange format. It was derived from the ECMAScript Programming Language Standard. JSON defines a small set of formatting rules for the portable representation of structured data. This document removes inconsistencies with other specifications of JSON, repairs specification errors, and offers experience-based interoperability guidance.
